img.alt: DEVELOPING CITIZENS WHO ARE LIFELONG LEARNERS

div.h2: DEVELOPING CITIZENS WHO ARE LIFELONG LEARNERS
div.p: The mission of the High Plains Community Schools is to provide an educational environment, which develops citizens who are lifelong learners and can contribute to a global society.

div.class: widget_text so-panel widget widget_custom_html panel-first-child panel-last-child

h3.a: 🎓Link to Pictures of the Class of 2020! 🎓

div.p: Click here to see pictures of the Class of 2020! These will also be available on the kiosk in the high school lobby when things return to normal.

h3.a: Daily Breakfast and Lunch Count Form

div.p: Please use the following form to sign up for the next day’s breakfast and lunch. Lunch counts will need to be submitted by noon each day for the next day’s breakfast and lunch. Click here for Breakfast/Lunch Count Form.

High Plains Community Schools will be closed through March 27th to participate in community intervention efforts to slow the spread of Covid-19. Be prepared for a potential closure of 6-8 weeks. NDE and the Governor will reevaluate the conditions every two weeks. More information regarding alternate/online curriculum, along with food service, will be provided within […]

In coordination with DHHS, Four Corners Health and Nebraska Department of Education, our district is monitoring the developing information related to the spread of COVID-19 (commonly referred to as the coronavirus). This is an unprecedented situation and remains extremely fluid. Should this situation interfere with the district’s ordinary operations or schedule, you will be provided […]
